item.title: Orcas Island Filmmakers Workshop
item.dc:creator: Yuri
item.content:encoded:
Become a part of a 12-member film production team, led by an Emmy-winning director and producer from Nashville, TN!

 
All Orcas Island students are invited to submit an application to be considered for this FREE, unique opportunity during this year's Orcas Island Film Festival. Application deadline is September 30th.
Over the four days of the Film Festival (October 4-7) you will learn how to create a story, write a script, build a crew, film, and produce a movie under the guidance of Nashville-based three-time Emmy-winning director and producer Mike Stryker. Towards the end of the four-day workshop, you will become a part of a crew responsible for a fully-produced Hollywood style video. Thursday and Friday afternoons will be devoted to pre-production workshops, and Saturday and Sunday will be spent filming and producing the video around the island.   [caption id="attachment_1128" align="alignleft" width="203"] Mike Stryker[/caption] WHAT: Four-day filmmaking workshop with EMMY-winning director and producer WHEN: Thursday, Oct 4: 4-7 PM Friday, Oct 5: 4-7 PM Saturday, Oct 6: 11 AM - 6 PM Sunday, Oct 7: 11 AM - 6 PM * Saturday and Sunday pizza lunch will be provided WHERE: Location details will be provided to those who are selected.   To be considered for the class, please fill out the application below: [contact-form-7 id="1124" title="Emmys Entry Form"] You will be notified by October 1st if you are selected!

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: subscriber
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: tucker
item.content:encoded:
Jumping Whale LLC Privacy Policy
This Privacy Policy describes how your personal information is collected, used, and shared when you visit or make a purchase from www.orcascars.com (the “Site”).
PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT
When you visit the Site, we automatically collect certain information about your device, including information about your web browser, IP address, time zone, and some of the cookies that are installed on your device. Additionally, as you browse the Site, we collect information about the individual web pages or products that you view, what websites or search terms referred you to the Site, and information about how you interact with the Site. We refer to this automatically-collected information as “Device Information.”
We collect Device Information using the following technologies:
- “Cookies” are data files that are placed on your device or computer and often include an anonymous unique identifier. For more information about cookies, and how to disable cookies, visit http://www.allaboutcookies.org.
- “Log files” track actions occurring on the Site, and collect data including your IP address, browser type, Internet service provider, referring/exit pages, and date/time stamps. - “Web beacons,” “tags,” and “pixels” are electronic files used to record information about how you browse the Site.
Additionally, when you make a purchase or attempt to make a purchase through the Site, we collect certain information from you, including your name, billing address, shipping address, payment information (including credit card numbers), email address, and phone number. We refer to this information as “Order Information.”
When we talk about “Personal Information” in this Privacy Policy, we are talking both about Device Information and Order Information.
HOW DO WE USE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION?
We use the Order Information that we collect generally to fulfill any orders placed through the Site (including processing your payment information, arranging for shipping, and providing you with invoices and/or order confirmations). Additionally, we use this Order Information to: Communicate with you; Screen our orders for potential risk or fraud; and When in line with the preferences you have shared with us, provide you with information or advertising relating to our products or services.
We use the Device Information that we collect to help us screen for potential risk and fraud (in particular, your IP address), and more generally to improve and optimize our Site (for example, by generating analytics about how our customers browse and interact with the Site, and to assess the success of our marketing and advertising campaigns).
SHARING YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION
We share your Personal Information with third parties to help us use your Personal Information, as described above. For example, we use Shopify to power our online store--you can read more about how Shopify uses your Personal Information here: https://www.shopify.com/legal/privacy. We also use Google Analytics to help us understand how our customers use the Site--you can read more about how Google uses your Personal Information here: https://www.google.com/intl/en/policies/privacy/. You can also opt-out of Google Analytics here: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout.
Finally, we may also share your Personal Information to comply with applicable laws and regulations, to respond to a subpoena, search warrant or other lawful request for information we receive, or to otherwise protect our rights.
BEHAVIOURAL ADVERTISING As described above, we use your Personal Information to provide you with targeted advertisements or marketing communications we believe may be of interest to you. For more information about how targeted advertising works, you can visit the Network Advertising Initiative’s (“NAI”) educational page at http://www.networkadvertising.org/understanding-online-advertising/how-does-it-work.
You can opt out of targeted advertising by:
Additionally, you can opt out of some of these services by visiting the Digital Advertising Alliance’s opt-out portal at: http://optout.aboutads.info/.
DO NOT TRACK Please note that we do not alter our Site’s data collection and use practices when we see a Do Not Track signal from your browser.
YOUR RIGHTS If you are a European resident, you have the right to access personal information we hold about you and to ask that your personal information be corrected, updated, or deleted. If you would like to exercise this right, please contact us through the contact information below.
Additionally, if you are a European resident we note that we are processing your information in order to fulfill contracts we might have with you (for example if you make an order through the Site), or otherwise to pursue our legitimate business interests listed above. Additionally, please note that your information will be transferred outside of Europe, including to Canada and the United States.
DATA RETENTION When you place an order through the Site, we will maintain your Order Information for our records unless and until you ask us to delete this information.
MINORS The Site is not intended for individuals under the age of 25 as we do not rent vehicles to those under 25.
CHANGES We may update this privacy policy from time to time in order to reflect, for example, changes to our practices or for other operational, legal or regulatory reasons.
CONTACT US For more information about our privacy practices, if you have questions, or if you would like to make a complaint, please contact us by e-mail at orcascars.com or by mail using the details provided below:
120 Buck Mountain Road, Eastsound, WA, 98245, United States

item.title: Orcas Island Taxi: The Time-Saving Alternative You Need
item.dc:creator: angela
item.content:encoded:
Orcas Island is a paradise of which many hope to see and experience in their summers. It is an island in a fun shape of a horseshoe and is very rural. It has many beautiful features such as hills, lakes, hiking trails, and the main attraction, the ocean. In the ocean, many magnificent wildlife resides there such as orca whales, also called the killer whale. These whales are gorgeous and there are even boat tours where you can get a closer look.

Orcas Island Car Rental

Renting cars from Orcas Cars is probably the best decision you can make on your journey to Orcas Island. To get to the island it is mostly a simple drive and then you need to hop on a ferry. In order to get to the island, you need to take a ferry. If you choose to leave your car behind, then you need some sort of transportation. Instead of taking a taxi, a good method of traveling is to rent a car. Doing so has so many upsides to the other alternatives. For one, to rent a car, it is one fixed rate. You pay to use the car for a day or however many days you need. No crazy taxi meters or exorbitant taxi rates. Not to mention the scarcity of them on the island. Also one of the best things about renting a car from Orcas Cars is that you do not need to depend on anyone to get you anywhere on the island. With a taxi, you have to plan and then call when you need a taxi. Then you’re not sure whether the taxi is going to be there in 5 minutes or 1 hour. Basically, your day in paradise will be depending on a taxi driver. All that is easily avoidable with having your own rented car to go wherever, whenever you need. Another awesome thing about Orcas Cars is that the car can be delivered to you right off the ferry. How amazing is that?! So, basically, as soon as you get off the ferry you can hop in the car that you choose and go to wherever you want on the island. The cars to choose from are pretty amazing as well. They have a brand new fleet and other options coming soon, like convertibles and Jeeps. This also gives you the ability to pick what is going to work best for you alone or you with your family. Just be sure to reserve in advance so that your car will be available to you when you reach the island.  

Orcas Island Water Taxi

Another cool service that Orcas Island has is a water taxi. This taxi can actually drive you around to the various islands around Orcas Island. Outer Island Excursions Water Taxi offers tours all over, from nearby islands around Orcas to destinations in Canada. It's not cheap, though. Depending on your destination and number of people it can be a much as $1,000 per HOUR. Yes. Per hour.

How Long is the Ferry From Anacortes to Orcas Island?

The ferry from Anacortes to Orcas Island is about 22 miles and takes roughly 1.5-2 hours to get there. The ferry requires reservations for cars, but it’s easier to walk on with no reservation and rent from OrcasCars.com (they deliver the cars to you!) As you can by now tell, renting a car is your best option to enjoy your Orcas Island vacation. Don’t stress yourself out by taking a taxi and relying on them to shape how you enjoy your relaxation time. Simply reserve a car in advance from Orcas Cars and then have it delivered to you for free, whether at the ferry terminal or one of the island's marinas. It’s fairly simple and gives you the power to make decisions and to decide how you want to spend your time. Orcas Island is a beautiful place with lots to do. From kayaking, hiking, whale watching, art festivals, music festivals, award-winning cuisine, and so much more. Choose right and go with OrcasCars.com so that you can enjoy all the island has to offer at your own pace!
Sources:
https://www.visitsanjuans.com/members/outer-island-excursions-water-taxi https://orcasislandtaxi.com

Orcas is a hidden paradise among the San Juans. Because of that, the Orcas Island taxi market is rough. Don't be caught without wheels, Orcas Island Car Rental is easy!

item.title: Orcas Island Car Rental: Find the Perfect Ride for Your Island Getaway
item.dc:creator: Sarah
item.content:encoded:
Located in the Northwestern corner of Washington State in San Juan County, Washington, is a serene little haven known as Orcas Island. Home to lush forests, sparkling waters, gorgeous wildlife, and picturesque mountains sceneries, the diversity of Orcas Island’s breath-taking landscapes makes it a dream destination for those looking to take a break from the hustle and bustle of city living and reacquaint themselves with nature. Humans aren’t the only species who have fallen in love with the beauty of Orcas Island though. In fact, Orcas Island houses a large population of sea otters, seals, bald eagles, deer, and of course – Orca whales. Though contrary to popular belief, Orcas Island did not get its name from the Orca whales that inhabit its waters. Rather, the name Orcas is the shortened version of Horcasitas - as in Juan Vincente de Guemes Padilla Horcasitas y Aguayo, 2nd count of Revillagigedo. Because of his sponsorship of the expedition that led to the island’s discovery, Orcas Island, as well as several other locations within North America, are named after him.

Getting Around Orcas Island

There are two primary ways in which to travel to Orcas island; sea or air. Tourists looking to travel to Orcas Island often book a flight on one of Kenmore Air’s seaplanes or airplanes. Alternatively, some other popular methods used by travelers to reach the island are taking a ride on the Washington State Ferry or sailing to the island on a private boat and docking at Rosario Marina or Deer Harbor. Regardless of how you reach the island, it will be important for you to have a good method of transportation to get around town once you arrive. With a massive amount of tourists each summer, Orcas Island car rental options are in short supply, OrcasCars.com is finally here to help!

Orcas Island Car Rental

OrcasCars.com is a hassle-free car rental service that is whole-heartedly dedicated to customer satisfaction and providing you with the best vehicles to make your trip around Orcas Island both smooth, and comfortable. So, if you’re looking for a dependable method of traversing this little slice of paradise, reserve a car with OrcasCars.com! Our service is unmatched. Looking to ride in style? Why not take one of our brand-new 2018 Hyundai Elantras for a spin! For customer convenience, we even offer free vehicle delivery to various locations around the island, so whether you’re flying in, sailing in, or coming by ferry to the island, you have the peace of mind in knowing that your rental will be ready and waiting for your arrival.

Features of our 2018 Cars

Below are some of the features in our fleet of new Hyundai Elantras:

Under the hood

  • A powerful 1.8L engine
  • Self-shifting transmission
  • 29 Mpg

Inside

  • Powered windows (so no fiddling with old-fashioned window cranks!)
  • 6-way seat adjustment that helps keep you comfy for those extended rides
  • Steering-wheel-mounted controls for driver’s convenience
  • AM/FM/MP3 audio system with 6 speakers to keep you jamming to your favorite tunes
  • Smartphone, USB, and Auxiliary Ports
  • Rear cupholders

Outside

  • Projector headlights
  • Power fold-away side mirrors

Eastsound Orcas Island Car Rental

Our company, located in scenic Eastsound, Washington, contains an excellent selection of vehicles that are perfect for all your traveling needs. Equipped for driver and passenger satisfaction and comfort, our rental cars are the best option when looking to cruise the gorgeous landscapes of Orcas Island.

Out with the Old and In with the New!

When renting a car, it’s important that you’re happy with what you’re getting behind the wheel of. So why not make it a brand new, up-to-date vehicle loaded with the latest tech!?

Locally Owned

Established by four passionate entrepreneurs who understood the importance of island transportation, OrcasCars.com is fully owned and operated by Orcas Island residents and long-time lovers.

Need Some Help with Your Orcas Island Adventure?

OrcasCars.com compiled a list of all the best locations to visit, our local secrets included, while on Orcas Island…and we’re sharing it with you, the customer, to help ensure that you have the best possible experience during your time here on the island.

Getting Around Orcas Island Today

Due to limitations in transportation methods, getting around Orcas Island can be challenging. Remember; it’s an island, which means that you’re not going to find the same amount of transportation options here that you would see on the mainland. You could try to get a ride from an Orcas Island Taxi; however, there is only one service like this available on the island, so during the peak season, they are incredibly busy. So, even if you manage to get a cab that can take you to that yummy-looking restaurant you’ve been dying to try out during your stay, there’s no guarantee that very same taxi will be available for the ride back – and getting stranded during your fun-filled vacation getaway doesn’t sound like much fun, does it? There’s always bicycling, but this would only be an effective way to get around if you’re intending to stay in town. For those looking to explore outside of town, trying to do so on a bicycle would be a nightmare given the island’s rough terrain. If you’re searching for a 100% reliable, and not exhausting, method of traversing Orcas Island and checking out the islands coolest locations, we recommend that you rent a vehicle from OrcasCars.com. We’ve made the process of reserving one of our top-notch vehicles quick and easy. Just follow the steps below:
  • Just hop onto your phone, computer, or tablet and go to OrcasCars.com
  • Click on the ‘Reservation’ option at the top of the page (book more than 24 hours in advance)
  • Fill out the reservation information

And that's it, you’re done!

By renting a car through OrcasCars.com, you can guarantee smooth sailing, or driving rather, during your entire trip around Orcas Island.

We Make It Easy!

Renting with OrcasCars.com is a seamless experience designed to maximize your time on Orcas Island. Here’s how it works:
  1. All reservations must be made online through OrcasCars.com
  2. Sign our rental agreement via DocuSign and submit a photo of your valid Drivers License and Insurance Policy Card
  3. Upon your arrival to the island, your car will be waiting for you at your specified pickup location
  4. Notify us of your arrival and we will unlock your car via its satellite technology
  5. At the time of return, park the car at your specified location and text us to confirm the car's location. Leave the key fob in the car and we will lock it remotely!
  While we do have a company headquarters office on the island, we do not rent vehicles from there. All of our vehicles are rented from conveniently located locations around the island.   [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Changes At Time Of Pick Up Or Return
item.dc:creator: subscriber
item.content:encoded: If at the time of vehicle pick up you wish to rent a different car or rent for a longer period, you may do so subject to availability, on payment of additional charges. Such charges may be at a higher rate than those previously quoted. 1 Day minimum rental required.

item.title: Security Deposit
item.dc:creator: subscriber
item.content:encoded: In the unlikely and unfortunate event that the vehicle is returned damaged, a $100 USD security deposit is being added to your reservation total. Upon the return of the undamaged vehicle, we will refund the full prepaid amount of $100 USD. Should the vehicle be returned with damage (scratched, dings, flat tires, ripped interior, etc) or with a fuel level less than full, we will deduct repair and refueling fees from your security deposit and refund the remaining amount, if any, to the card in which it was originally charged.

item.title: Cancelation Policy
item.dc:creator: subscriber
item.content:encoded:
Your rental rate is calculated based on the information provided at the time of booking. Any change to a reservation will be recalculated based on the availability and prices at the time the change is made. This may be greater or lesser than the price originally booked. This applies to changes made to:
  • Drop off location
  • Pick up date and time
  • Drop off time and date
  • Vehicle package
  • All other vehicle add-ons
Any changes to a reservation must be done by emailing hello@orcascars.com. Please include your reservation number in the subject of your email. If a reservation is canceled 24 hours before the Pick Up Time, we will refund your full prepaid amount. A $50 cancellation fee will also be assessed. If a reservation is canceled less than 24 hours before the Pick Up Time, we will refund your full prepaid amount, less a full day’s rental rate. If you fail to cancel your reservation prior to the Pick Up Time and do not collect the vehicle on the Pick-Up Date, or if you fail to comply with the Terms of the Rental Agreement, no portion of the prepaid amount will be refunded. Refunds will go back on the card that the original reservation was made on.

item.title: Getting Around Orcas Island: How to Get Where You Want to Go
item.dc:creator: subscriber
item.content:encoded:
Getting to Know Orcas Island

Orcas Island Is Named For the Orca Whales, Isn’t It?

No, actually Orcas Island is named for Juan Vincente de Güemes Padilla Horcasistas y Aguayo, 2nd Count of Revillagigedo who, while serving as the Viceroy of Mexico, authorized the 1791 expedition that charted the islands. Another Spanish expedition a year earlier had discovered the islands, but had not ascertained with certainty whether or not they were islands. Francesco de Eliza led the 1791 expedition. He shortened the name “Horcasistas” to create the name for Orcas Island as well as naming the island cluster and Guemes Island in honor of the Viceroy.

Where is Orcas Island in Washington?

Orcas Island is the largest and northern most of the circular cluster of the San Juan Islands. This island cluster is located in the Salish Sea between the northwestern coast of the state of Washington and the eastern tip of Canada’s Vancouver Island. It is almost directly due south of Vancouver, north northwest of Seattle, and east northeast of Victoria, British Colombia.

What Can I Expect When Visiting Orcas Island?

Orcas Island is an inviting, mostly rural, vacation and day trip destination that is extremely popular with San Juan Islands visitors, especially in July and August. Although these are warm months, summer time highs on Orcas Island generally remain comfortably around 70°F (21°C). Orcas Island, like all of the San Juan Islands, is sheltered from the warm, moist, rain-producing winds off of the Pacific by the Olympic Mountains to the south. Winds from the south and southwest ascend the mountains, into the cooler air near the peaks and the rains fall on the coastal side. With such perfect weather, Orcas Islands hamlets and varied terrain invite you to come outside. As you might expect in the Pacific Northwest, the land rises from flatlands through rolling hills to mountain peaks. The tallest of these is Mount Constitution, which is located in Moran State Park and which reaches a height of 2,399 feet.

How to Get Around Orcas Island

Orcas Island encompasses 57.3 square miles, and it is shaped a bit like a bowtie floating on the Salish Sea. The ferries dock at Orcas, which is at the southern tip of the western loop of the bowtie. Eastsound, located on the northern top of East Sound at the southern edge of where the bowtie’s knot would be, is the largest and northern most of the hamlets on Orcas Island. It’s on the opposite side of the island from Orcas. West Beach and Deer Harbor join Orcas on the western loop of the drooping bowtie, while Rosario, Olga, Doe Bay, and Sea Acre occupy the eastern loop of the bowtie.

Do I Need a Car on Orcas Island?

You’ll find the hamlets are widely scattered along the shorelines. In addition, you might want to visit Moran State Park, the Turtleback Mountain Preserve, Obstruction Pass State Park, Doughty Point, or the Orcas Island Golf Course. Even if you are accustomed to riding in biking events that extend over several days and miles, you will probably want to take a car so that you have the time and energy to enjoy your destination when you arrive. You can bring your own car or RV across on the ferry, take one of the seasonal shuttles, take a taxi, or rent a car from Orcas Cars any time of the year.

How to Get to Orcas Island From Seattle

You have three options for getting to Orcas Island. If you want to take your car or RV onto the island, you can take the Washington State Ferry from Anacortes and debark in the village of  Orcas. You can fly in to Deer Harbor by sea plane, or you can fly in to the Orcas Island Airport at Eastsound.

How far is Orcas Island from Seattle?

When traveling from Seattle to Orcas Island, all roads lead to the ferry at Anacortes. The length of the drive depends on the road you take. The fastest and shortest route follows I-5 N. It is 102.6 miles long and takes approximately three hours.

How to Get to Anacortes From Seattle

To get to Anacortes from Seattle:
  • Starting on Madison St. in Seattle, head southwest 197 feet toward 4th Ave.
  • Pass by the Wells Fargo Bank on the left, and turn right just after you pass Bartell Drugs, which will also be on the left side of the street.
  • University St. will be the third cross street, and you’ll reach it after 0.2 miles. Turn right onto University St.
  • In 0.1 miles, you’ll merge to take the I-5 N ramp for Vancouver, BC, which will be the ramp on the left. Then, in 0.3 miles you will merge onto I-5 N.
  • Remain on I-5 N for 63.8 miles until you reach exit 230. This will be the exit for WA-20 which takes you to Burlington, Anacortes, and the Skagit Airport.
  • After 0.4 miles, you will turn left onto the WA-20 W/Avon Cutoff.
  • Remain on WA-20 W for 11.6 miles, and then, after 0.2 miles, make a slight right to take WA-20 Spur-W.
  • Remain on WA-20 Spur W for 2.5 miles, and then turn right when you reach R Ave.
  • Remain on R Avenue for 0.9 miles and then turn right onto Q Ave.
  • Remain on Q Ave. for 0.5 miles, until you reach 13th street. Turn left onto 13th Street.
  • Continue on 13th for 367 feet to the first cross street, which will be Commercial Avenue. Stay on Commercial Avenue for 299 feet until you reach 12th street in Anacortes.

How to Get From Seattle to Anacortes Ferry

To get to the ferry after you reach Anacortes:
    • Remain on 12th street for 1.1 miles, and then continue onto the WA-20 Spur W which is also Oakes Ave.
    • Follow the WA-20 Spur W for 2 miles, and then move to the right lane and remain there. Continue to follow the WA-20 Spur W for 0.4 miles.
    • After 0.4 miles, make a slight right to enter the WSF (Washington State Ferry) Holding Lanes and follow the Holding Lanes for 171 feet. From this point until you reach the ferry, you will be on toll roads or partial toll roads, but it’s the only way to reach the ferry.
    • After 171 feet, turn left toward the Anacortes Ferry Terminal.
    • After 39 feet, make a slight right toward the ferry terminal and continue for 0.2 miles.
    • Continue onto the ferry terminal for 449 feet, and then take the Anacortes – Orcas Island Ferry to the hamlet of Orcas on Orcas Island.
You can you can take your car onto the ferry or you can park your car at the terminal, walk onto the ferry, and rent a car from Orcas Car Rentals on the island. If you don’t plan on driving your car on the island, parking it at the terminal is the better option because parking spaces on the island are more limited than the ones available at the terminal, and they fill up quickly. In addition, if you walk onto the ferry, you won’t need a reservation. If you will be visiting Orcas Island in July or August and you will be taking your car on the ferry, it’s best to make your ferry reservations in advance at the Washington State Department of Transportation website under the headings for ferries and fares. Be sure to choose the ferry for Orcas Island. Fares depend on the number of people in the vehicle, their ages, whether or not anyone has a disability, and the size of the vehicle. Children, seniors, and those with disabilities receive discounts. The ferry can transport RVs, and there is a campground and RV park in Orcas on Orcas Islands.

Getting From Here to There on Orcas Island

If you are leaving your car at the ferry terminal, renting a car from Orcas Cars is the best option for visiting all of the hamlets and experiencing everything that there is to see and do on Orcas Island. You can reserve your car online at OrcasCars.com, and it’s best to make this reservation in advance as well. Orcas Cars offers a sporty Mustang convertible that seats four and holds three bags; the Hyundai Elantra Ltd., a four-door sedan, that seats five and holds four bags; and the Chevy Traverse that seats eight and holds four bags. OrcasCars.com can accommodate everyone from couples to families and small groups. Several taxi service companies are also available. In addition, you can rent bikes and mopeds. On weekends throughout the summer, the San Juan Transport shuttles make the rounds on Orcas Island with stops at West Sound, the trailhead at Turtleback Mountain Preserve, Deer Harbor, the weekend Farnmers’ Market in East Sound, the Orcas Island Golf Course, Moran Park, Cascade Lake, Country Corner, and Rosario Resort. Large groups can charter a shuttle. There are also tours of the hamlets, but taking a tour means that you are on the tour company’s schedule, not your own.

What to Do on Orcas Island

Enjoy the beaches, hike or bike the trails, go horseback riding, try out the fresh and salt water fishing, play some golf, go kayaking, take a whale watching tour, take a wildlife tour by land or by sea, take a tour of the hamlets, or drive between the small villages yourself to wander through the art galleries and shops featuring the creations of local artists and artisans. Then, stop for lunch and dinner at one of the many restaurants offering dishes comprised of locally sourced ingredients. Some restaurants feature organic foods, and some offer fruits and vegetables straight from the farm or garden to the table.

Where to See Orcas in Seattle

You can catch whale watching tours from Seattle that will take you to the waters around Orcas Island and the other islands of the San Juan Island archipelago, but you don’t have to sail that far. In fact, you actually don’t have to sail anywhere at all. Whale watching tours also sail Puget Sound, but there are locations where you can watch the whales from land through binoculars. In some cases, adult whales that have come to feed on the abundant ghost shrimp along the bottom of Puget Sound come to within 50 feet of the shore. Begin following whale tracking blogs published by groups like Orca Network and check Orca Network’s map of Whale Sighting View Points. Become familiar with whale watching locations, how to reach them, and where to park so that when you learn that there has been a sighting, you can reach the destination quickly. You never know whether the whales are just passing by or whether they may linger a while. You’ll enjoy whale watching more if you do a little research on identifying the species of whales that are likely to be around Seattle at different times of the year. Whale species can be identified not only by their size, body shape, the shape of their tails or flukes, and the shape of their dorsal fin or their lack there of but also by the size and shape of the spray from their blowholes. You may see the spray before you see anything else, but for other telltale signs that give away the location of a whale pod, watch for gulls circling over a particular spot above the water as they hope to dine on the leftovers from the feeding whales. Also watch for tour boats that stop at a particular location, but keep in mind that tour boats are required to stop quite some distance from the whales to avoid collisions and injuries to the whales and passengers. Some whale watching points to explore include:
        • Alki Beach, 1702 Alki Ave SW, Seattle (West Seattle)Bigg’s orcas are attracted to this beach by the resident seals and seal pups. Consequently, this is probably not the best site for whale watching with young or sensitive children, or sensitive teens or adults for that matter.
        • Bush Point, E. Spyglass Dr., Freeland, WAThis point on Admiralty Inlet is an alternative to South Whidbey State Park, and it offers the same view of the inlet as you would have from the state park. The park requires a Discover pass, and you need to hike to the whale watching location. Bush Point is south of the state park.
        • Mukilteo Beach, 609 Front St., Mukilteo, WAThis is another alternative to South Whidbey State Park for those who miss the ferry to Whidbey Island or for those who might miss the whales if they try to catch the ferry. While the state park is on the west side of Whidbey Island, this beach offers a view of the east side of the island, so pay close attention to the posted whale sightings to try to determine where the pod is and in which direction it is moving.
        • Point Defiance, 5400 N. Pearl St., Tacoma, WASeveral whale watching points along Five Mile Drive, which is in Point Defiance Park, offer views of south Vashon Island. Humpback whales may linger here, remaining in Puget Sound for the winter. Orcas also swim around the island as they head down Puget Sound.
        • Point No Point, 9009 Point No Point Rd. NE, Hansville, WAFrom Point No Point, you have a view of Puget Sound to the south and Admiralty Inlet to the north. From this location, you have the opportunity to see whales of all species. Orcas come particularly close to the shore as they enter Puget Sound.
        • Point Robinson, 3705 SW Point Robinson Rd., Vashon, WashingtonPoint Robinson, located on Maury Island, provides easy access to a beach where the orcas come to within less than 50 feet of land. Take the ferry from Fauntleroy or Southworth to Vashon Island, and then head south to the narrow bridge of land that joins Vashon Island and Maury Island at Portage.
        • Possession Point, 8343 Franklin Rd., Clinton, WAAdult humpback whales come to the shallow waters around Possession Point to feed on krill.
        • Thomas Hladkey Memorial Park, 100 Anthes Ave., Langley, WAThomas Hladkey Memorial Park is located on the east side of Whidbey Island, almost directly opposite South Whidbey State Park. If you need directions to this park, use its more common name, Whale Bell Park. The park gained this nickname from a brass bell that was donated to the city of Langley by the Orca Network. From this vantage point, you have the opportunity to see the gray whales that seem to prefer swimming around Camano Island. Whenever a visitor sees a whale passing through the Saratoga Passage between Whidbey Island and Camano Island, he or she is supposed to ring the bell.

          What to See on Orcas Island

          Of course you can see orcas and other whales from Orcas Island, but Orcas Island offers far more.
        • Starting with the whales, though, boat tours of the San Juan Islands and tours specifically devoted to whale and dolphin watching depart from both Eastsound and Deer Harbor.
        • Eastsound also hosts the Orcas Wildlife Institute for Learning and Discovery or Orcas W.I.L.D. This interpretive center is staffed by local naturalist guides and features educational and interactive displays not only about whales but also about the geology of the intertidal zone of the islands and the wildlife within it. Orcas W.I.L.D. is located at 217 Main St., Eastsound, Orcas Island, WA.
        • To learn more about the history and heritage of Orcas Island, visit the Orcas Island Historical Museums, also in Eastsound. Each of the six museums is contained within a log cabin that was built on the island and which was home to one of the island’s early residents. The cabins were dismantled and brought to their present location in Eastsound, and the displays within each one focuses on a different period of the island’s history. The displays include letters written by some of the island’s early settlers, and you can read these to gain insight into what life was like for them. The museums are located at 101 N. Beach Rd., Eastsound, Orcas Island, WA.
        • Orcas Island Pottery perches on a cliff overlooking the water. The site consists of a number of cabins and features pieces of pottery from the collections of several different artists. The pieces are displayed indoors and outdoors, and some of the artists are available to answer questions. In addition to the pottery, you’ll find a garden, a swing with a view of the water, and a treehouse where children can play while adults browse. The shop is located on a rural road at 338 Old Pottery Rd., Eastsound, Orcas Island, WA, and it’s ranked as one of the top paces to see on Orcas Island.
        • Orcas Island Artworks is one of the oldest artists’ co-ops in the United States. It features the work of 45 island craftspeople and artists, representing one of the premier collections of arts and crafts available on the San Juan Islands. Choose from jewelry, wearable art, fiber creations, prints, paintings, glasswork, pottery, sculpture, and woodworks. The artists own and operate the gallery themselves, so it’s likely that you could meet one or more of them during your visit. Orcas Island Artworks is located in the historic Olga Strawberry Barreling Plant at 11 Point Lawrence Rd., Olga, Orcas Island, WA.
        • Rosario Resort and Spa includes the Moran Mansion, home of shipbuilder Robert Moran. Moran also served as a Mayor of Seattle, but he purchased 7,000 acres, retired to Orcas Island, and built his mansion between 1904 and 1909 after being told that his shipbuilding business, The Moran Bros. Company, had taken such a toll on his health that he had only a few years to live.The business began with ship repairs and supplied ships during the Yukon Gold Rush before becoming a major West Coast shipyard and, by 1902, Seattle’s largest employer. Early on, Moran had associated with photographer and preservationist John Muir. After absorbing President Theodore Roosevelt’s conservation policies, Moran offered several thousand of his 7,000 acres to the state of Washington to create one of the state’s first state parks. That land became Moran State Park which borders on Rosario Resort. Architecturally, the mansion combines influences from the Arts and Crafts movement and shipbuilding. The mansion contains the original fixtures and furnishings including original photographs from the 1800s and 1900s, a 1913 Aeolian pipe organ with 1,972 pipes, and a 1900 Steinway piano. You can take self-guided tours of the mansion daily from 8am-9pm. In addition, Tuesday through Saturday at 4pm from the summer through mid-September, you can attend the Organ Concert and Rosario History Narrative presented by Rosario historian, author, and musician Christopher Peacock. The presentation includes photographs from the historic Moran Photograph Collection. After mid-September, you can still attend the presentation on Saturday at 4pm.
If you’re more interested in the outdoors, you can get active on the land or the water.
        • Deer Harbor Marina is the place to go for paddleboard, kayak, sailboat, and powerboat rentals. The Deer Harbor Marina includes the Marina Barge Gift Shop. The marina is located at5164 Deer Harbor Rd., Deer Harbor, Orcas Island, WA.
        • Moran State Park, on the east side of Orcas Island, offers camping and a number of hiking trails. Some are longer than others, but even healthy seniors report that they are walkable. Some of the trails offer detours to sites where you can jump into a lake, literally jump into a lake, for a swim. The trail to Mt. Pickett passes through one of the few areas around Puget Sound that has never been logged. The trail up Mt. Constitution leads to the Ellsworth Storey Mt. Constitution Observation Tower which offers expansive views of the San Juan Islands, the Canadian Rockies, the Olympic Mountains, and more.
        • Orcas Island Trail Rides will bring their horses, meet you at Moran State Park, instruct you on riding safety and the commands for controlling the horses, and guide you on  a tour along the trails of Moran State Park. You choose the length of the ride. Experienced and inexperienced riders alike recommend this equestrian tour. Orcas Island Trail Rides is located in Olga, Orcas Island, WA.
        • The Turtleback Mountain Preserve, on the west side of Orcas Island, features the steeper climb up Turtleback Mountain. How you rate the climb depends on your fitness level and how accustomed you are to hiking mountain trails. This trail averages a 9 percent to 10 percent grade with some steeper sections. You will find a number of benches where you can stop to rest, however. Taking a climbing stick is helpful. Taking a water bottle is recommended, especially on a warm day. Breaks in the foliage along the trail reveal picturesque views for those who undertake the climb, so taking a camera is a must. Turtleback  Mountain is located on Wild Rose Lane, Orcas Island, WA.
Sources: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Juan_Islands https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orcas_Island http://orcasislandchamber.com http://www.gonorthwest.com/Washington/sanjuan/Orcas/orcas_island.htm https://www.orcasislandgetaway.com https://www.visitsanjuans.com/about-the-islands/orcas-island https://www.tripadvisor.com/Tourism-g58656-Orcas_Island_San_Juan_Islands_Washington-Vacations.html https://www.seattlemag.com/news-and-features/best-whale-watching-sites-puget-sound-you-dont-need-boat Orca Network Whale Sighting View Points https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=1xIsepZY5h_8oA2nd6IwJN-Y7lhk

item.title: Orcas Island Airport: Improving to Be More Convenient and Welcoming
item.dc:creator: subscriber
item.content:encoded:
The Orcas Island Airport occupies 64 acres located just 1 nautical mile north of Eastsound’s main business district. That places the airport in convenient proximity to the island’s largest town. Orcas Island Airport has some air taxi service and commercial flights from Kenmore Air, San Juan Air, and NorthStar Air Tours, but it’s used most frequently for general aviation.

Orcas Island Airport Expansion

To meet FAA requirements, Orcas Island Airport has created a master plan to guide its development over the next 20 years. The goals of the plan are two-fold: To assess and meet the short-, mid-, and long-term needs of the island, its residents, and its visitors and to bring the airport into compliance with FAA safety standards for airport operations. Specifically, while the Cessna 208B Caravan airplane has been and continues to be used extensively by operators of both passenger and cargo flights that regularly service the island, the current configuration of the airport does not meet the FAA’s safety standards for servicing these and other planes currently flying to and from the island. To meet safety standards, the plan includes the following changes among others:
  • Widening and lengthening the runway
  • Increasing the width of the runway’s shoulders
  • Increasing the distance between the runway and the taxiways
  • Expanding the safety areas and the object-free areas around the runway and the taxiways
  • Constructing a storage facility for airport equipment
  • Constructing a deicing facility
  • Moving the terminal 30 feet from its current location, which requires constructing a new terminal
  • Expanding the short-term parking area
While devising proposed versions of the plan, the airport presented a variety of alternate plans. All of these plans presented options for making the best possible use of the island airport’s current facilities and property to meet the FAA’s safety requirements and to provide for the future air transport needs of the island while minimizing any undesirable impacts on businesses and residents close to the airfield. Toward those ends, the airport provided multiple opportunities for input from residents and business owners. However, to alleviate some concern and confusion that has developed among residents regarding the changes, no part of this 20-year plan includes provisions for expanding the airport property or for accepting flights from planes larger than those that have already been servicing the island for years. Further, none of the proposed versions of the plan ever included a provision for allowing larger planes to fly to the island or for the expansion of the airport property. The plan focuses solely on a relocation and reconfiguration of facilities within the current bounds of the airport.

The Orcas Island Airport Three Letter Code

When booking a flight to this island airport, double check the code because the Orcas Island Airport three letter code is a bit confusing. Instead of one identifying code, like most airports, it has two. While the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) assigned the letters ORS, for Orcas Island, to the airport, the International Air Transport Association (IATA) had assigned that three letter code to Orpheus Island Resort Waterport in Queensland, Australia. So, the IATA assigned ESD, for Eastsound, to the airfield. Just be certain that you know which airport code you need to use when you fill out the form to book a flight, the FAA code or the IATA code.

Flights to Orcas Island

Three airlines provide regular passenger service to Orcas Island -- Kenmore Air, San Juan Airlines, and NorthStar Air Tours. Kenmore Air flies out of Seattle-Tacoma (SeaTac) International Airport (SEA), and you can land at Orcas Island Airport in Eastsound or fly by seaplane to West Sound, Rosario Resort, or Deer Harbor. San Juan Airlines flies from Point Roberts, British Columbia to Eastsound, from Bellingham or Anacortez, Washington to Eastsound, and to Friday Harbor and Roche Harbor on San Juan Island as well as to Blakely Island and Lopez Island. NorthStar Air Tours offers regularly scheduled flights between Victoria, British Columbia, Eastsound, and Friday Harbor on San Juan Island. In addition, you can fly from Tofino, B.C. to Victoria. NorthStar also has routes planned from Vancouver, B.C and Bellingham, WA to Eastsound and from SeaTac to Victoria, BC. All three airlines also offer tours and charter flights.

Friday Harbor Airport

The Port of Friday Harbor on San Juan island is located on public land, and it is home to both the Friday Harbor Airport and the Port of Friday Harbor Marina. Planes, seaplanes, and fishing and recreational boats are all welcome. Both the airport and the marina serve as a U.S. Customs points of entry. The airport provides a full service facility for airplanes The marina is in downtown Friday Harbor, and the island airport is within walking distance of the downtown area. Friday Harbor is the largest town on the San Juan Islands and offers lodging, restaurants, theaters, and art galleries. However, rental cars and public transportation are both available if you want to explore other parts of San Juan Island.

Orcas Island Weather

Between the water and the shelter of the Olympic Mountains, Orcas Island is blessed with temperate weather conditions. You aren’t likely to encounter anything that could ruin a summer vacation. The water keeps highs around 70°F (21°C) in July and August. In the winter, lows hover between 30°F and 40°F (-1°C to 4°C). The Olympic Mountains lift the moist air coming in from the south from the ocean, causing the rain to fall on the seaward side of the mountains. Visits to Orcas Islands don’t often require rainy day alternatives. However, the islands can sometimes experience high winds. Winds out of the northeast can give rise to Arctic-level wind-chills and brief freezes during the winter, but snow, when it falls, is limited to the higher mountain peaks. Sources: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orcas_Island_Airport http://www.portoforcas.com https://kenmoreair.com/ http://sanjuanairlines.com/ https://www.northstarairtours.com/ https://www.seattletimes.com/life/travel/shortest-north-american-flight-begins-feb-2-linking-friday-harbor-victoria/ https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Juan_Islands

item.title: Orcas Island Shuttle: Brand New Cars Just for You!
item.dc:creator: Sarah
item.content:encoded:
Located in San Juan County, Washington sits a beautiful island called Orcas Island. This island is of a horseshoe-shape and has 57.3 square miles of gorgeous terrain. It's the perfect mix of secluded nature and quaint small town with incredible food. It is a perfect place to kick back and relax and is often visited by nearby Seattle executives for a weekend getaway. Among the activities on the are kayaking, cycling, hiking, and my personal favorite, eating. Along with all that, the island is rich with local musicians and artists.

Orcas Island Shuttle: Your Best Options

To explore this beautiful island, we suggest a car so you can get to all the fun places and hidden gems of the island. One of the best places to get a car is OrcasCars.com. OrcasCars has a variety of cars that you can choose from as well, from brand new Hyundai Elantras to Jeep Wranglers and convertible Mustangs coming soon. OrcasCars, the premier Orcas Island Car Rental service, offers brand new cars, so you can travel in style, which is what makes them really stand out on the island. The site works like any other car rental service. Just choose the dates you need, then the car you'd like from the available choices. We then deliver the car to you! Whether arriving by ferry, boat, or seaplane - or even if you arrived by car with a group and want your own wheels for a day or so - we'll bring the car to you.

Where is Orcas Island Wa?

Orcas Island is located in San Juan County, Washington. It includes Moran State Park and has 38 miles of hiking trails. There are also numerous lakes at the park. Just off the coast of the island, you can also take excursions to see Orca Whales, also known as killer whales. Although the island wasn't actually named after Orcas whales (Orcas is a shortened version of the Spanish explorer who discovered the island in 1791), they are native to the area!

How Do You Get to Orcas Island?

One of the best and easiest ways to get to Orcas Island is to go by ferry. The Washington State Ferries system services Orcas and surrounding islands with multiple ferries arriving and departing each day. The ferries can be accessed at the Anacortes, Washington terminal, which is about 1.5-2 hours north of Seattle, WA. Reservations are required for cars, but you can just walk on if you're planning to rent a car on the island. Another easy way to get to Orcas Island is by taking a plane. If choosing the plane route, you will depart from Seattle on Kenmore Air or from Anacortes or Bellingham via San Juan Airlines. Reserve your car with OrcasCars.com in advance to have the car delivered to you when you step off the ferry or plane!

How Far is San Juan Islands from Seattle?

The distance between the San Juan Islands and Seattle is about 102 miles. From Seattle, you then have to drive to Anacortes, Washington. This takes about 1.5-2 hours and is about 81 miles. Most of your journey is done, and from there you take the ferry from Anacortes to the San Juan Islands. The ferry to any of the San Juan Islands ranges from 1-2 hours.

How to get to San Juan Islands from Seattle airport?

From the Seattle airport, you really have one reliable airline, Kenmore Air. Their seaplanes depart from a couple location in Seattle (take your pick) and arrive at Rosario Marina on Orcas Island. This is our top suggestion for those of you living in Seattle traveling to the island or if you're flying into Seattle. It's such a hassle to drive up to Anacortes, take the ferry, yadda yadda yadda. When planning your trip, just book a Kenmore Air flight, reserve your Orcas Island Shuttle / Orcas Island Car Rental with OrcasCars.com, and your island vacation is set!

How long is the Ferry from Anacortes to Orcas Island?

The ferry from Anacortes to Orcas Island is about 22 miles and takes roughly 1.5-2 hours to get there. The ferry requires reservations for cars, but it's easier to walk on with no reservation and rent from OrcasCars.com (they deliver the cars to you!)

When to See Orcas in San Juan Islands?

Orcas Island is a beautiful place and a great experience if you choose to go. The best time of year to go is between late May to the middle of September. Summer is the best as it is very pretty this time of year and the Orcas whales can be best seen at that time of year too. Orcas Island is one of the best-kept secrets in the US. Do your research before visiting and take in all the beautiful hiking. And don't leave without trying the incredible food on the island. From Madrona Grill, for a good steak or Inn and Ship Bay for the most decadent scallops you'll ever eat. Oh, and of course, rent a gorgeous car from OrcasCars.com!
Sources:
https://www.visitsanjuans.com/about-the-islands/orcas-island https://www.orcascars.com/ http://visitorcas.info/

item.title: Orcas Island Transportation: Everything You Need to Know
item.dc:creator: angela
item.content:encoded:
The scenic gem of the San Juans Islands, Orcas Island, is full of adventures for every visitor. It delivers gorgeous views of the ocean, waterfalls, and plenty of ways to connect to the island’s history, culture, and wildlife. There are plenty of popular sites and activities in the 57 square miles of this beautiful island. Moran State Park is a popular place for tourists to visit with over 5,252 acres of land that contains several lakes and 30+ miles of hiking trails. The entire island is a combination of winding roads and a very hilly landscape. Hiking and cycling are just two of the ways that visitors like to get around the park and different parts of the island. However, that may not be ideal means of travel for those who aren’t major thrillseekers or those who are traveling with family. This is where Orcas Island transportation services come in. They allow people to travel through the island without having to make long hiking or cycling trips if they’re not completely up for it.

What sort of transportation services are available on the island?

For people who are looking for airport transportation services, there are options to get you to and from your destinations around the island. There are taxi services, and car rentals through OrcasCars.com, and ferry services for getting to the island. There are also water taxis available to take you to your various destinations for excursions and exploring. It’s also the perfect way to get to and from other San Juans islands. If you’re looking to take travel into your own hands, there are definitely options for car and moped rentals as well. We highly recommend renting a car through OrcasCars. During peak season, the current options for rentals and taxis are maxed out with tourists, so reserve ahead of time!

Traveling to Orcas Island via Kenmore Air

Kenmore Air provides flights to the Washington and Vancouver areas. Passengers are able to take flight via seaplane or wheeled plan from Seattle to one of several points of entry for planes on the Orcas Islands. Passengers can choose to fly by private charter if they so choose. Visitors can choose to enter several different locations on Orcas Island including Deer Harbor, East Sound, West Sound, or the Rosario Resort. Deer Harbor is located on the west side of the island settled between two peninsulas on the island. It’s the best place for travelers to visit for cycling and kayaking. Private charters are available for these flights, but there is no complimentary baggage storage on site. The Orcas Island Airport or East Sound is located at the northern part of the island. Eastsound is one of the largest towns on the island. There are a number of activities available in this area including a variety of entertainment, restaurants and excursion opportunities. There is complimentary baggage storage onsite. West Sound was once home to the Coast Salish tribes, the original inhabitants of the island. This is the best place to visit if you are looking to fish for fresh seafood. It’s also home to the Orcas Island Yacht Club. There is no complimentary baggage storage onsite for this area. Finally, visitors to the Orcas Island can choose to fly into Rosario Resort via seaplane. Visitors can gain a taste of Old World Orcas Island here. Located here is a 1909 Mission-style mansion that contains a cocktail lounge, store, and a gorgeous waterfront restaurant. There is no complimentary baggage storage for this area. No matter which destination you choose, OrcasCars.com will deliver your car to you at no charge!

Arriving Via Ferry - Anacortes to Orcas Island

If you would prefer to drive your own vehicle around the island, your only option is to utilize the Washington State Ferry system. Access to the San Juan Islands, where Orcas Island is located, is via the Anacortes ferry terminal. Reservations are required to bring your vehicle on the ferry and you must arrive no later than 30 minutes prior to departure to get in line. If you are later than 30 minutes prior you will lose your reservation and be placed into the standby line. Sound stressful? It can be. So, instead, just walk on to the ferry (no reservation required) and rent a car with OrcasCars.com - your car will be delivered to you at the Orcas ferry terminal!

Orcas Island Car Rental

A more feasible option for ferry riders may be to ditch their car before boarding and rent from OrcasCars instead. The reservation process is simple and it’s literally as easy as 1,2,3. The first step is to choose your pickup location and date and your drop off location and date. Next, you can select from a list of available vehicles and vehicle add-ons. The last step is to review rates and enter your payment information to reserve the vehicle. You can also call them to ask any questions. Premier Orcas Island Car Rental service OrcasCars now offers a new fleet of 2018 Hyundai Elantras. These cars are perfect for navigating Orcas Island in comfort and style. Whether you choose to take the ferry or choose to fly in with Kenmore Air, renting a car OrcasCars is simple and stress-free! No matter how you choose to spend your time on the beautiful Orcas Island, the one thing that you will never have to worry about is transportation to, from, and around the island. Orcas Island transportation services reduce travel stress so that you can focus on relaxing. These transportation services provide peace of mind, just what every vacation should feel like.   Sources https://www.visitsanjuans.com/search?search_api_views_fulltext=transportation https://www.visitsanjuans.com/members/orcas-island-rental-cars-vans https://www.visitsanjuans.com/members/friday-harbor-jolly-trolley-transportation https://www.orcascars.com/

item.content:encoded:
Sometimes called the Emerald Isle by locals, Orcas Island is the ultimate vacation destination for those looking to escape their daily routine and go on the ultimate adventure. Green, lush forests, tranquil lakes, majestic wildlife, fantastic foods, and fine art – it’s no wonder many visitors to the island eventually find permanent residents here, including household names such as superstar media mogul Oprah Winfrey, who recently purchased an $8.3 million-dollar compound on the island. Orcas Island has something for everyone. If you’re looking to enjoy the peace and tranquility of nature, take a ride on a wildlife and whale watching tour to catch a glimpse of the Orca whales and other marine life that inhabit the nearby waters or a scenic hike through Moran State Park, where you’re likely to find wild deer, rabbits, and foxes roaming the natural landscapes. Alternatively, if you’re visiting the island for a taste of culture and fine dining, you can satisfy your pallet or shopping needs in Eastsound, Deer Harbor, or Olga - these villages are perfect destinations for foodies, shoppers, and art enthusiasts alike. To put it simply, whether you’re travelling to Orcas Island in hopes of reconnecting with nature, a shopaholic looking to get your hands on some amazing loot, a lover of museums and fine art, or just hoping to explore everything this incredible island has to offer, you’ll find everything you want right here.

Orcas Island Airport Car Rental

So, you’ve finally decided to take that much-deserved dream vacation to Orcas Island that you’ve been talking about forever. You’ve booked your flight and packed your bags – but have you considered what you’re going to do for transportation once you land? You certainly don’t want to spend the first 2-3 hours of your time on the island scouring the phonebook and calling around to find a ride to your hotel. Why stress on your vacation when you could just reserve a car right at the airport from OrcasCars.com? By reserving a ride with us, you ensure that a reliable, stylish car will be waiting for you as soon as your flight arrives!

How to Get to Orcas Island from Seattle

There are several different modes of transportation to reach Orcas Island from Seattle, Washington. Many visitors choose to hop on one of the Washington State Ferries from Anacortes, while others simply sail in by way of a private boat to reach the island. Additionally, you can also choose to book a flight to the island using Kenmore Air, which has daily seaplane flights landing right on the island.

How Long is the Ferry from Anacortes to Orcas Island?

The ride from Anacortes to Orcas Island on the Washington State ferry is surprisingly quick, lasting only around 50 min to an hour depending on the route that is taken. Below are some important things to take note of when considering the ferry as your method of transport. If you’re planning on taking the ferry to Orcas Island, it’s highly recommended that you arrive earlier than the time your ferry is expected to disembark. For walk-on passengers, ensure that you are ready and prepared to board no later than five minutes before departure, but we recommend 15-20 minutes. However, if you’re hoping to bring your personal vehicle along for the ride to Orcas Island, you will need to schedule reservations for this in advance. Additionally, it’s important to have your vehicle in line for loading at least 30 minutes prior to the ferry’s departure. Additional fees may be charged depending on the size of your vehicle. Does making vehicle reservations, waiting forever in line, and being charged unexpected fees sound like a good way to start off your vacation? Not when you could just reserve a car with OrcasCars.com! In addition to their affordable daily rates, OrcasCars.com also offers free vehicle delivery directly to you! So, instead of having to haul your car to the Orcas Island and back on the state ferry, why not just make life a little bit easier and rent a car from your friends at OrcasCars.com

Where Is Orcas Island Washington

Orcas Island is located in San Juan County, Washington. It is one of the four popular island destinations located in the Northwestern corner of Washington State. Orcas Island is actually the largest of all its neighboring islands.

Fun fact:

There are roughly 172 named reefs and islands located in San Juan County. However, there are only four that are served by the Washington State Ferry – San Juan Island, Friday Harbor, Lopez Island, and Orcas Island.

How to Get to San Juan Island from Seattle

Often, the most convenient and popular way travelers reach San Juan Island from Seattle is flying via Kenmore Air, an American airline Located in Kenmore, Washington – just north of Seattle. Kenmore Air offers flights to Orcas Island, as well as other neighboring San Juan Islands, by either seaplane or airplane. Additionally, San Juan Airlines offers daily scenic, charter, and scheduled flights to the islands of San Juan from Bellingham, Anacortes, and Seattle.

When to see Orcas in San Juan Islands

If you’re hoping to see Orca whales on your visit to the San Juan Islands, it may be good to schedule your trip around certain times in the year when the whales are most prevalent. Though Orcas can be seen all throughout the year, the best times to go whale watching is most often between May and October. This is because salmon runs are at their strongest during these times, so whales will be more present during their search for food.

Orcas Island Car Rental

Vacations should be a time where you can relax, decompress, and just really enjoy yourself. So, don’t you want a car that will make those scenic drives a pleasant experience? Let OrcasCars.com ensure that your island drives are both safe and comfortable. We will even deliver your rental car to you anywhere on Orcas Island for no additional cost. Our brand-new collection of 2018 Hyundai Elantras is perfect for both comfort and reliability. Reserve your ride today at www.OrcasCars.com or give us a call at: (406) 530-7090.

item.title: Orcas Island Transportation Doesn't Have To Be A Hassle
item.dc:creator: Ashley
item.content:encoded:
Orcas Island, the largest of the San Juan Islands, is located in northwestern Washington. It’s 57.3 square miles and is home to just over 5,000 residents. But tourists love visiting Orcas Island, too. There’s so much to do. According to Orcas Island’s Chamber of Commerce website, it considers itself a “magical mix of arts and culture, lush forests, placid lakes, and endless outdoor possibilities.” The island’s crown jewel is the beautiful Moran State Park. Its 5200 acres are bound to excite enthusiastic hikers everywhere. You can either hike on your own or choose to take a guided tour. There’s also plenty of opportunities to rent kayaks or boats to cruise the surrounding waters to sightsee and fish. Or you can hop on a bike to tour the countryside. You can even take a whale-watching tour! So, it’s an outdoorsy person’s paradise. But there’s also plenty to do for “indoor cats” as well. You can visit spas or explore the island’s fine dining opportunities. And there is tons of activities, restaurants, and entertainment in Eastsound. There’s really something for everyone! But how do you actually get to Orcas Island? Let’s find out!

How to get around Orcas Island?

There are many modes of transportation available on Orcas Island once you arrive. If you prefer to drive yourself, Orcas Island Rental Car has sedans, mini-vans, convertibles, and large vans available for rent year-round. If you would rather have someone else drive you around, Orcas Island Taxi is a great option. They are family owned and operated and available 24 hours. New Orcas Taxi Tours also offers rides, including vans. OrcasCars.com, the latest addition to the thriving transportation market on the island, is also a great option. With a fleet of brand new Hyundai Elantras - which have leather interior and some cool premium features - they're the first to offer a fully digital transaction from booking to pick up and drop-off. If cars aren’t your thing, there’s plenty of ways to get around by water. North Shore Charters offer the highest quality boat tours within the San Juan Islands. It’s perfect for fishing and day cruises to Canadian destinations. Orcas Boat Rentals & Charters has a variety of 14- to 24-foot boats. Maybe you’re more into a little bit of luxury. Good thing San Juan Airlines has you covered. With flights to five different locations in the San Juan Islands, you can charter one for business or pleasure. Kenmore Air also provides an easy and quick way to fly from Seattle right to the San Juan Islands. And if you’re looking to get up close and personal with Orcas Island, Wildlife Cycles is a full-service bike shop that offers bike rentals as well as suggested rides. If you brought your own two-wheeled bike to the island, they even offer repair services.

What is Kenmore Air?

Kenmore Air offers flights to and from San Juan Islands, Seattle, Vancouver, and Victoria so you can reach your destination quicker than by boat or car. Another great way to take advantage of Kenmore Air is by taking one of their adventurous tours. They offer scenic tours of Seattle, Mount Rainer, and Mount Saint Helens, and a San Juan Islands Ride-Along.

How do I get to Orcas Island from downtown Seattle?

Getting to Orcas Island from Seattle is easy! You have two different airlines to choose from: Kenmore Air and San Juan Airlines. Kenmore Air provides land and seaplanes from Lake Union, Lake Washington, and Boeing Field. You can also charter a plane from San Juan Airlines from Boeing Field or SeaTac. You can hop on the Bellair Airporter Shuttle from downtown Seattle and take it to the Anacortes ferry terminal. And finally, the Greyhound Bus is another option. They provide service from Seattle to Mount Vernon. From there, you would need to transfer to a Skagit Transit bus or the Number 208 bus to Cascade Mall and then transfer to the 410 route to the Anacortes ferry terminal. But that last bus is unavailable on the weekends. So, you should stick with a less-complicated option.

Does Orcas Island have a taxi service?

There are two different taxi services on Orcas Island. Orcas Island Taxi is a family-owned and operated business and is available 24 hours a day. New Orcas Taxi Tours also offers rides, including vans.

Can I take the Washington State Ferry to Orcas Island?

Yes, the Washington State Ferry provides over a dozen daily sailings to the San Juan Islands from the ferry landing in Anacortes. You can either walk-on or drive-on. You should check the schedule to ensure that the ferry you’re riding on is actually visiting Orcas Island at that time.

If I want to drive to Anacortes, how do I do it?

You can definitely drive to Anacortes, get on a ferry, and drive with your car onto Orcas Island. But remember, you will need to plan ahead. You need to make a reservation to drive on to the ferry and will need to pay for your ticket and your car. However, consider walking on to the ferry and renting a car when you get there. It’s so much more simple!

How do I get rental cars on Orcas Island?

If you prefer to drive yourself but don’t want to bring your own car, check out one of the few options for rental cars we mentioned above. You can walk on to the ferry in Anacortes and rent a car when you get there. You can also take Kenmore Air from Seattle and rent a car, too.

Where is Rosario Resort?

You will find Rosario Resort and Spa on Cascade Bay, near Eastsound village. It includes The Mansion Restaurant, which offers gourmet-quality breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily. You can also take advantage of their on-site spa, which includes a sauna, treatment room, mirrored exercise and weight rooms, a whirlpool, and indoor therapeutic pool – not to mention fantastic views of Cascade Bay. You can get a spa treatment or take a fitness class. The Moran Mansion at Rosario was built by Mayor Robert Moran between 1906 and 1909 and houses original, turn of the century photographs, furnishings, and ships built by the Moran Brothers Company in Seattle.  
Sources https://orcasislandchamber.com/web-category/category/transportation/ https://www.kenmoreair.com https://orcasislandchamber.com/getting-here http://orcasislandchamber.com/20182019Guide.pdf https://orcasislandchamber.com/orcas-island https://rosarioresort.com
